full_summary:
## Request for Abbreviated Proposals (RFAP) for an Energy Consulting Services Source List

### Overview

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is soliciting abbreviated proposal from consulting firms to establish a Source List (SL) to provide professional services for the Department of National Defence (DND) in various Canadian locations across the Pacific and Prairies regions. 

### Background and Scope

The scope of the project includes establishing a SL for two regions (Region 1: Pacific and Region 2: Prairies) to provide professional services in the areas of energy evaluation, energy conservation systems, architectural services, and other related fields. Firms that consider themselves qualified to provide these services are invited to submit their abbreviated proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System.

### Regions and Estimated Value

The two regions are:

* **Region 1: Pacific** (British Columbia): Estimated value of up to $2,700,000.00 for a period of three years. 
* **Region 2: Prairies** (Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba): Estimated value of up to $3,900,000.00 for a period of three years. 

### Proposal Evaluation Criteria and Requirements 

Information provided by the proponents will be evaluated using established criteria in the RFAP documents. Proposers must meet the minimum requirements for qualifications, experience, and expertise for the selected service areas outlined in the RFAP documents.

### Tender Requirements

- Closing Date: November 29, 2022 - 2:00 PM (Eastern Time)
- Proposal submission method: MERX Electronic Bidding System

### Contract Information

- Interested bidders must register on the MERX website to submit proposals.
- Contact information for DCC:
  - Leger, Keltie (Procurement Specialist)
  - Email: [keltie.leger@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:keltie.leger@dcc-cdc.gc.ca)
  - Phone: 343-542-5027
- Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) and contract award details available on the DCC website at [dcc-cdc.gc.ca]( http://dcc-cdc.gc.ca ) under Contract Activity.

Registered bidders can participate in the process. Proposals submitted outside of the specified timeframe will be rejected. Bidders are strongly advised to review the RFAP documents thoroughly for comprehensive information.
